item.title: Items in invent
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“blitz_9100, post:5, topic:177166”]look for this

		for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { //Setting player items
			playerItems[i] = 0;
		}

and where it says playerItems[i] = 0;
replace it with this

playerItems[0] = 995;

0 is the item slot
and 995 is the item id (which seems to be 1 less than the orignal in my server)
look below that you should see the item amound do the same to that but replace 995 with the item amount

hope this helps :)[/quote]

for(int = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { if(i != 0) playerItems[i] = 0; playerItems[i] = 995; }

Would be better.

I knew I was forgetting to tell you something.
You have to set the item amount below that. If you can’t, then… uh, wow.

Read full topic

item.title: Items in invent
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

look for this

		for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { //Setting player items
			playerItems[i] = 0;
		}

and where it says playerItems[i] = 0;
replace it with this

playerItems[0] = 995;

0 is the item slot
and 995 is the item id (which seems to be 1 less than the orignal in my server)
look below that you should see the item amount do the same to that but replace 995 with the item amount

hope this helps

Read full topic

item.title: Items in invent
item.dc:creator: @bluurr bluurr
item.description:
@bluurr wrote:

player.java add to these

		for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { //Setting player items
			playerItems[1] = 0;
		}
		for (int i = 0; i<playerItemsN.length; i++) { //Setting Item amounts
			playerItemsN[1] = 0;
                        }
